basics.name: Mark Chou
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am student majoring in Finance and Management Information Systems at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. I expect to graduate in either Summer or Fall 2020.

education.institution: University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa, Honolulu, HI

work.position: Assistant to Teacher's Assistant for ICS 101 Course
highlights: Helped students get back on track with the lesson when they are lost or confused in lab session
Created two lesson plans and taught them to the class
Tutored students that needed help in the course for at least three hours weekly

work.company: Boys & Girls Club of San Francisco, Tenderloin Clubhouse
work.position: Assistant to High School Services Director
highlights: Answered phone in professional manner, wrote down detailed messages, and accessed messages on machine
Learned and understood how to enter data into the TraxSolutions database and the process for double checking it
Started sign-in sheets for programs, knew where to find completed sheets if needed, and made copies of sheet
Attended workshops to explore the departments of Salesforce which included technology, marketing, and sales
Learned about history and purpose of Salesforce and how they became a successful business
Created an imaginary app with peers and presented the product to a group of Salesforce employees

volunteer.organization: Mayor's Youth Employment and Education Program
highlights: Practiced and improved public speaking skills, created and presented a PowerPoint presentation
Collaborated with peers to complete group projects and activities
Participated in time management, budgeting, professionalism and communication workshops

awards.title: University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa Dean’s List
Boys & Girls Club Youth of the Year Scholar
